recipes.name: Lemon and Sugar Pancakes for Pancake Day
directions: 1. Gather all ingredients and equipment: a 7-inch (18cm) or 8-inch (20cm) frying pan, kitchen paper, greaseproof paper, a palette knife or flexible spatula, a ladle, and a mixing bowl.
2. Sift the flour and salt into the mixing bowl.
3. Make a well in the center of the flour mixture. Crack the eggs into the well and pour in half of the milk.
4. Whisk together the eggs and milk, gradually incorporating the flour until a smooth, thick batter forms.
5. Beat thoroughly to remove any lumps, then stir in the remaining milk.
6. Transfer the batter to a jug or a bowl with a pouring lip.
7. Heat the frying pan over medium-high heat. Once hot, reduce the heat to medium.
8. Melt the butter in the pan. Pour off any excess melted butter into a bowl. Add 2 tablespoons of the melted butter to the batter and whisk it in.
9. For a test pancake, pour 2 tablespoons of batter (for a 7-inch pan) or 3 tablespoons (for an 8-inch pan) onto the hot pan, tilting to spread the batter thinly.
10. Cook for 30-60 seconds per side, or until golden brown.
11. Flip the pancake with a palette knife and cook the other side until golden brown.
12. Slide the cooked pancake onto a plate.
13. Repeat steps 9-12 for the remaining batter, adding a little more butter to the pan as needed.
14. To serve, sprinkle each pancake with freshly squeezed lemon juice and caster sugar. Fold in half, then in half again to form triangles, or roll them up into tubes.
15. Garnish with extra lemon wedges and a sprinkle of caster sugar.

A cut lemon wedge sits beside the stack, with a few sugar granules scattered around.  Use soft, natural light from the side to highlight the golden texture and create gentle shadows.  Shallow depth of field, focusing on the front pancake's surface.  Background a subtly textured light grey linen.  Mood: bright, cheerful, and inviting.  Composition should be slightly off-center for a dynamic feel.  Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint for a pop of color.

video_script.title: Lemon & Sugar Pancakes for Pancake Day
video_script.description: A simple and delicious recipe for classic lemon and sugar pancakes, perfect for Pancake Day!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a stack of golden brown, fluffy lemon and sugar pancakes, folded into triangles and dusted with caster sugar. A few lemon wedges are placed alongside.
scenes.voice_over: Get ready to flip for these fluffy Lemon & Sugar pancakes, perfect for Pancake day! This simple recipe is quick, easy and utterly delicious.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of the ingredients arranged on a table: plain flour, salt, eggs, milk, butter, lemons, and caster sugar.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: 110g plain flour, a pinch of salt, 2 large eggs, 275ml of low-fat milk, 55g of butter, fresh lemons, and caster sugar for sprinkling.

scenes.image_prompt: Show sifting flour and salt into a mixing bowl.
scenes.voice_over: First, sift the flour and salt into a mixing bowl. This adds air for lighter pancakes.

scenes.image_prompt: Show whisking eggs and milk in the well of the flour mixture, gradually incorporating the flour.
scenes.voice_over: Make a well in the center and crack in the eggs. Add half the milk and whisk, gradually incorporating the flour until smooth.  Then, whisk in the remaining milk.  Make sure there are no lumps!

scenes.image_prompt: Show melting butter in a frying pan and adding some to the batter.
scenes.voice_over: Melt the butter in a pan over medium-high heat. Reduce to medium. Pour off excess butter and add 2 tablespoons to the batter. Whisk well.

scenes.image_prompt: Show pouring batter onto the hot pan and tilting to spread.
scenes.voice_over: Pour 2-3 tablespoons of batter onto the hot pan, tilting to spread thinly. Cook for 30-60 seconds per side, or until golden brown.

scenes.image_prompt: Show flipping the pancake with a palette knife.
scenes.voice_over: Flip and cook the other side until golden. Slide onto a plate and repeat with the remaining batter, adding more butter as needed.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of squeezing lemon juice and sprinkling caster sugar onto a cooked pancake.
scenes.voice_over: Sprinkle each pancake generously with fresh lemon juice and caster sugar.

scenes.image_prompt: Show folding a pancake into triangles or rolling it into a tube.
scenes.voice_over: Fold into triangles or roll into tubes. Garnish with extra lemon wedges and a sprinkle of caster sugar. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For thinner pancakes, add a little more milk to the batter.
If making ahead, pancakes can be reheated in the microwave for 2 minutes on medium power or in a 180°C oven for 10 minutes, wrapped in foil.
Pancakes freeze well. Stack them with greaseproof paper in between and store in freezer bags.

recipes.name: Savory Herb Pancakes with Smoked Salmon and Crème Fraîche
ingredients: 2 cups scallions, thinly sliced or cut into 2-inch ribbons
1 cup fresh herbs (such as parsley, chives, tarragon), loosely packed and finely chopped
1 cup dark leafy greens (such as kale or swiss chard), finely chopped
3 tablespoons neutral oil (such as canola oil), plus more as needed
directions: Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
Step 2: Preheat a well-seasoned cast-iron skillet or nonstick skillet (9-12 inches) over low heat for 2 minutes.

Step 3: In a medium bowl, combine the scallions, herbs, greens, flour, water, egg, and salt. Gently mix with your hands until just combined. The batter will be thick and will hold the vegetables together.

Step 4: Increase the heat to medium. Add 1 tablespoon of oil to the skillet. Once shimmering, add 1/3 of the batter (about 1 cup) to the skillet, spreading it evenly to about 6 inches wide. Tap the outer edges of the pancake towards the center to create a round shape.
Step 5: Cook for 3-4 minutes, or until the bottom is golden brown. Gently tilt the pan and flip the pancake. If the pan seems dry, drizzle about 1 tablespoon of oil around the pancake's edge.

Step 6: Using a spatula, press down on the pancake to thin it and widen it to 7-8 inches. If raw batter leaks, tilt the pan and lift the pancake to allow oil to flow underneath. Cook for 2-3 minutes, or until golden brown.
Step 7: Flip the pancake once more to cook any leaked batter. Cook for 1 minute.
Step 8: Transfer the cooked pancake to a wooden board to absorb steam and maintain crispness. Repeat steps 4-7 with the remaining batter and oil to make two more pancakes.
Step 9: Once cool enough to handle, slice the pancakes into wedges and serve with smoked salmon and crème fraîche.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a stack of three Savory Herb Pancakes, revealing the vibrant greens within, topped with elegantly draped smoked salmon and a dollop of crème fraîche. Use soft, diffused natural light from the side to highlight the textures.  A dark slate background with a linen napkin alongside will create a rustic yet sophisticated mood.  Shallow depth of field, focusing on the salmon and the top pancake's edge, blurring the background slightly. Garnish with a sprinkle of fresh herbs and a few scallion ribbons.  Shoot from a slightly elevated angle, showcasing both the height and texture of the stack.

scenes.voice_over: Preheat your cast-iron or nonstick skillet over low heat for 2 minutes, then increase to medium. Add oil, and once it shimmers, pour 1/3 of the batter into the skillet. Spread it to about 6 inches wide.

scenes.voice_over: Cook for 3-4 minutes per side, or until golden brown. Flip the pancake, add a little more oil if needed, and press down gently to thin it and widen it to 7-8 inches. Cook for another 2-3 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the cooked pancake being transferred to a wooden board. Steam should be slightly visible.
scenes.voice_over: Transfer the cooked pancake to a wooden board to absorb steam and stay crispy. Repeat the process with the remaining batter. You should have three pancakes in total.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the finished dish. Three savory herb pancakes, sliced into wedges, are beautifully plated. Each wedge is topped with smoked salmon, a dollop of crème fraîche, and a sprinkle of fresh herbs. The plating is elegant and appetizing.
scenes.voice_over: Once the pancakes are cool enough to handle, slice them into wedges. Serve with smoked salmon, a dollop of crème fraîche, and a sprinkle of fresh herbs. Enjoy!

scenes.image_prompt: A wide shot of the plated dish, garnished and ready to serve, along with suggested drinks and side dishes.
scenes.voice_over: These savory pancakes pair beautifully with a crisp white wine or a refreshing mimosa. For a complete meal, serve alongside a fresh green salad.

cooking_tips: Use a well-seasoned cast-iron skillet for best results.
Don't overmix the batter.
Pressing down on the pancake helps it cook evenly and become crispy.
A wooden board helps keep the pancakes crispy after cooking.

recipes.name: Classic Fluffy Pancakes
directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, sift together the flour, sugar, salt, and baking powder.
Step 2: In a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, vanilla extract, melted butter, and egg.
Step 3: Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, mixing gently until just combined. Do not overmix.
Step 4: Let the batter rest for 5 minutes.
Step 5: Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium heat (approximately 325°F).
Step 6: Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the hot griddle for each pancake.
Step 7: Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
Step 8: Serve immediately with your favorite toppings.

recipes.name: Garlic Chive and Prawn Pancakes
ingredients: 90g garlic chives, cleaned and cut in half
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, cornstarch, salt, garlic powder, and onion powder.
Step 2: Gradually whisk in the ice water until a smooth batter forms. Add the garlic chives and prawns, mixing gently to combine.
Step 3: Heat the rice bran oil in a large frying pan or skillet over medium-high heat. To test if the oil is hot enough, drop a small amount of batter into the pan; if it sizzles, the oil is ready.
Step 4: Reduce the heat to medium. Using a ladle, pour a portion of the batter into the hot pan, spreading it thinly and evenly to form a circle.
Step 5: Cook for 3-4 minutes, or until the edges begin to set and the top surface looks partially cooked.

Step 6: Carefully flip the pancake and cook for another 3-4 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through. If needed, add a little more oil around the edges of the pancake while cooking. Gently press down on the pancake with a spatula to ensure it crisps up.
Step 7: Transfer the cooked pancake to a plate or cutting board. Repeat steps 4-6 with the remaining batter.
Step 8: Slice the pancakes into bite-sized pieces and serve immediately with your favorite dipping sauce.

recipes.name: Golden Cornmeal Pancakes
ingredients: ½ teaspoon salt (if using unsalted butter)
directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, cornmeal, baking powder, salt (if using), cinnamon, and brown sugar. Set aside.
Step 2: In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg and vanilla extract. Add the milk and honey, and whisk until well combined.
Step 3: Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and gently fold with a spatula until just combined. Do not overmix. Add the melted butter and fold until incorporated.
Step 4: Let the batter rest for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat. Add 1 teaspoon of butter to the hot pan.
Step 5: Give the batter a quick stir. If it seems too thick, add a tablespoon or two of milk to thin it out. Pour ¼ cup of batter onto the hot griddle for each pancake.
Step 6: Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through. Flip the pancakes when bubbles start to form on the surface and the edges look set.
Step 7: Repeat with the remaining batter, adding more butter to the pan as needed. Serve immediately.

A small pitcher of warm maple syrup sits beside them, with a pat of melting butter atop the stack. scenes.voice_over: In another bowl, whisk together 1 large egg and 2 teaspoons vanilla extract. Add 1 ¼ cups whole milk and 2 tablespoons of honey. Whisk until everything is well combined.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the wet ingredients being gently folded into the dry ingredients with a spatula.
scenes.voice_over: Now, gently fold the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Be careful not to overmix – a few lumps are okay.  Add 2 tablespoons of cooled, melted butter and fold until just combined.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of the batter resting in a bowl, covered with a clean kitchen towel.
scenes.voice_over: Let the batter rest for 5 minutes. This allows the gluten to relax, resulting in lighter, fluffier pancakes. Meanwhile, heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of pancake batter being poured onto the hot griddle from a measuring cup, forming round pancakes.
scenes.voice_over: Pour ¼ cup of batter onto the hot griddle for each pancake. Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through. Flip the pancakes when bubbles start to form on the surface and the edges look set.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a spatula flipping a golden brown pancake on the griddle.
scenes.voice_over: Don’t press down on the pancakes while they’re cooking - this will make them dense.  Just let them cook until golden brown and cooked through.

cooking_tips: Don't overmix the batter, as this can make the pancakes tough.
Use a non-stick pan or griddle to prevent sticking.
Adjust the heat as needed to ensure even cooking.

recipes.name: Fluffy Buttermilk Pancakes
ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat pastry flour (or all-purpose flour)
1 tablespoon vegetable oil, clarified butter, or nonstick cooking spray
directions: Step 1: In a mixing bowl, beat eggs on medium speed until frothy.
Step 2: Add buttermilk, melted butter, and vanilla extract. Continue to beat until just combined.
Step 3: In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
Step 4: Gently fold the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until just combined. The batter should be lumpy. Do not overmix.
Step 5: Let the batter rest for 5 minutes.
Step 6: Heat a lightly oiled griddle or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Step 7: Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the hot griddle for each pancake.
Step 8: Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
Step 9: Serve immediately with desired toppings.

recipes.name: Kimchi Pancakes (Kimchi Jeon)
ingredients: 1 to 2 cups kimchi, chopped (such as baechu kimchi)
directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, combine the flour, beaten eggs, water, chopped kimchi, and salt.
Step 2: Let the batter rest for 10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Step 3: Check the batter consistency. It should be slightly thinner than American pancake batter for even cooking. Add a little more water if needed.
Step 4: Heat a nonstick skillet or griddle over medium heat. Lightly coat with vegetable oil.
Step 5: Pour approximately 1/3 of the batter onto the hot skillet, spreading it thinly to form a pancake.
Step 6: Cook for 3-4 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through. Add more oil as needed between pancakes.
Step 7: Flip the pancake and cook the other side for another 1-2 minutes.
Step 8: Serve immediately, garnished with sliced scallions and a side of soy sauce for dipping (optional).

video_script.title: Crispy & Flavorful Kimchi Pancakes (Kimchi Jeon)
video_script.description: Learn how to make delicious and easy Kimchi Pancakes (Kimchi Jeon) with this simple recipe. Perfect as a snack, appetizer, or side dish!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a stack of golden-brown kimchi pancakes, garnished with sliced scallions. A small bowl of soy sauce is next to the pancakes.
scenes.voice_over: Craving a savory and satisfying Korean treat?  Let's make Kimchi Pancakes, or Kimchi Jeon! These crispy, flavorful pancakes are surprisingly easy to whip up and perfect for any occasion.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a table: flour, eggs, water, kimchi, salt, oil, scallions, and soy sauce.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: two cups of all-purpose flour, two large eggs, one and a half cups of water, one to two cups of chopped kimchi - I'm using baechu kimchi - one teaspoon of salt, one teaspoon of vegetable oil, and optionally, some sliced scallions for garnish and soy sauce for dipping.

scenes.image_prompt: A large bowl with flour, eggs, water, kimchi, and salt being mixed together with a whisk.
scenes.voice_over: In a large bowl, combine the flour, beaten eggs, water, chopped kimchi, and salt. Whisk everything together until just combined.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of the batter resting in the bowl, covered with a clean kitchen towel.
scenes.voice_over: Let the batter rest for about 10 minutes. This allows the flavors to meld and the flour to fully hydrate.

scenes.image_prompt: The batter being checked for consistency - a spoon is lifting some batter to demonstrate the slightly thinner than American pancake batter consistency.
scenes.voice_over: Now, check the batter's consistency.  It should be slightly thinner than American pancake batter.  If it's too thick, add a little more water, a tablespoon at a time, until you reach the desired consistency.

scenes.image_prompt: Vegetable oil being lightly coated on a preheated nonstick skillet over medium heat.
scenes.voice_over: Heat a nonstick skillet or griddle over medium heat. Lightly coat it with vegetable oil.

scenes.image_prompt: Batter being poured onto the hot skillet, forming a thin pancake.
scenes.voice_over: Pour about 1/3 cup of batter onto the hot skillet, spreading it thinly to form a pancake. Cook for 3-4 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through.

scenes.image_prompt: A spatula flipping the golden-brown pancake.
scenes.voice_over: Flip the pancake carefully and cook the other side for another 1-2 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the finished kimchi pancakes stacked on a plate, garnished with scallions and served with a side of soy sauce.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your kimchi pancakes immediately, garnished with sliced scallions and a side of soy sauce for dipping, if desired. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: Adjust the amount of kimchi based on your spice preference.
A non-stick pan is recommended for easy flipping.
Serve with a side of rice for a complete meal.

recipes.name: Banana Walnut Pancakes with Caramelized Bananas
ingredients: 4 tablespoons coconut sugar or unbleached cane sugar
Extra coconut oil for greasing the pan
3 tablespoons coconut sugar or light brown sugar
2-3 large bananas, sliced about ½ inch thick
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Caramelized Bananas: In a medium, non-stick skillet over medium heat, combine the coconut oil and coconut sugar. Once melted, increase the heat to medium-high and cook for 1 minute.
Step 2: Add the sliced bananas to the skillet, swirling to coat them in the sugar mixture. Cook for 2-3 minutes, until bubbles form and the bananas darken. Remove from heat and set aside.
Step 3: Make the Pancake Batter: Combine all pancake ingredients except the diced bananas and walnuts in a blender. Pulse until smooth.
Step 4: Pour the batter into a bowl and fold in the diced bananas and walnuts.
Step 5: Cook the Pancakes: Heat a tablespoon of coconut oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.

Step 6: Using a small ice cream scoop or a tablespoon, pour batter onto the hot skillet. Cook for about 3 minutes per side, or until bubbles form and the edges are set. Flip carefully and cook for another minute until cooked through.
Step 7: Add ½ - 1 teaspoon of coconut oil to the pan between batches, and remove any leftover batter scraps.
Step 8: Serve the pancakes hot, topped with caramelized bananas, walnuts, and maple syrup (if desired).

Use a dark, moody background with soft, diffused natural light from the side, highlighting the golden-brown pancakes and glistening caramelized bananas. Garnish with chopped walnuts and a drizzle of maple syrup. Focus on the texture of the pancakes and the glossiness of the bananas, using a shallow depth of field to blur the background.  Shoot from a slightly elevated angle, showcasing the height of the stack and the flowing syrup. Include a vintage silver fork beside the plate.

recipes.name: Crispy Kimchi Pancakes (Kimchi Jeon)
directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, sift together the flour and salt. Add the water and whisk until smooth. Add the beaten egg, chopped kimchi, kimchi juice, and optional chilies. Mix well.
Step 2: Add the ice cubes to the batter to keep it cold.
Step 3: Heat a generous amount of vegetable oil in a large non-stick skillet or griddle over medium-high heat.
Step 4: Once the oil is hot, ladle a portion of the batter onto the skillet, spreading it into a thin, even circle.

Step 5: Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and crispy, flipping when the edges start to set and the bottom is cooked through. Press down gently with a spatula to ensure even cooking.
Step 6: Remove the pancake from the skillet and drain on paper towels. Repeat with the remaining batter.
Step 7: Slice the pancakes into bite-sized pieces and serve immediately with kimchi pancake dipping sauce.

recipes.name: Alton Brown's Instant Pancake Mix and Pancakes
ingredients: 1/2 cup unsalted butter, for greasing the pan
2 cups fresh fruit (such as blueberries), optional
directions: 1. **Make the Pancake Mix:** In a container with a tight-fitting lid, combine the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
2. Shake well to combine and store until ready to use.
3. **Make the Pancakes:** In a small bowl, whisk the egg whites until soft peaks form.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and melted butter.
5. In a large bowl, combine the buttermilk and egg yolk mixture. Whisk until thoroughly combined.
6. Add 2 cups of the prepared pancake mix to the wet ingredients.
7. Whisk gently until just combined. Do not overmix; a few lumps are okay.
8. Heat a griddle or large skillet over medium heat. Test the heat by sprinkling a few drops of water onto the surface. The griddle is ready if the water droplets dance and evaporate quickly.
9. Lightly butter the griddle and wipe off any excess with a paper towel.
10. Gently ladle the pancake batter onto the hot griddle, leaving some space between each pancake.
11. If desired, sprinkle fresh fruit (such as blueberries) over the batter.
12. Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through. Flip the pancakes when bubbles begin to set around the edges and the underside is golden.
13. Serve immediately or transfer to a towel-lined baking sheet and cover with a clean towel to keep warm until ready to serve.

scenes.voice_over: Heat a griddle or large skillet over medium heat. A few drops of water should dance and evaporate quickly on the surface when it's ready. Lightly butter the griddle and wipe off any excess. Ladle the batter onto the hot griddle, leaving space between each pancake.

recipes.name: Pumpkin Pancakes with Cranberry Syrup
directions: Step 1: In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together the pancake mix, pumpkin pie spice, and brown sugar.
Step 2: In a separate bowl, whisk together the pumpkin puree, canola oil, vanilla extract, and water.
Step 3: Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Do not overmix.
Step 4: If the batter is too thick, add a tablespoon of water at a time until desired consistency is reached.
Step 5: Heat an electric griddle to 375°F or preheat a lightly oiled non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat.
Step 6: Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the hot griddle for each pancake.
Step 7: Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
Step 8: For the Cranberry Syrup: Combine cranberries, granulated sugar, and water in a small saucepan.
Step 9: Bring to a simmer over medium heat and cook for 10 minutes, or until the cranberries have burst.
Step 10: Remove from heat and let cool for 15 minutes.
Step 11: Transfer the cranberry mixture to a blender and add the maple syrup. Blend until smooth.
Step 12: Serve the pancakes topped with the cranberry syrup.

recipes.name: Heart-Shaped Buttermilk Pancakes
directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Step 2: In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs and buttermilk.
Step 3: Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and whisk until just combined. Do not overmix.
Step 4: Whisk in the melted butter.
Step 5: Heat an electric skillet or cast iron skillet over medium heat.
Step 6: Lightly grease the skillet and heart-shaped pancake molds with vegetable oil.
Step 7: Place the molds on the hot skillet and pour less than 1/4 cup of batter into each mold, spreading it out to fill the mold.
Step 8: Cook for 2 to 2 1/2 minutes per side, or until golden brown.
Step 9: Carefully remove the molds and flip the pancakes.  Cook until the other side is golden brown.
Step 10: Repeat steps 6-9 with the remaining batter, greasing the skillet and molds between batches.
Step 11: Serve immediately with your favorite toppings.

recipes.name: Fluffy Banana Pancakes with Coconut-Lime Sauce
ingredients: 185ml (3/4 cup) light coconut milk (A Taste of Thai brand)
3 ripe medium bananas, peeled and finely chopped
Melted reduced-fat dairy spread (Devondale Light brand), for greasing
1 tablespoon light coconut milk (A Taste of Thai brand)
directions: Step 1: Sift the flour into a medium bowl and make a well in the center.
Step 2: In a separate jug, whisk together the coconut milk, reduced-fat milk, eggs, and 1 tablespoon of brown sugar.
Step 3: Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, whisking constantly until the batter is smooth and combined.
Step 4: Set the batter aside for 20 minutes to rest. Preheat oven to 100°C (212°F).
Step 5: Gently fold the chopped bananas into the rested batter.
Step 6: Heat a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat and brush with melted dairy spread.
Step 7: Pour 60ml (1/4 cup) of batter per pancake onto the hot pan, leaving space for spreading. Cook for 2 minutes, or until bubbles appear around the edges and the underside is golden brown.
Step 8: Carefully flip the pancakes and cook for another minute, or until golden brown and cooked through.
Step 9: Transfer cooked pancakes to a heatproof plate, cover loosely with foil, and place in the preheated oven to keep warm.
Step 10: Repeat steps 6-9 with the remaining batter, greasing the pan between batches.

Step 11: To prepare the sauce, combine 2 tablespoons brown sugar, water, and 1 tablespoon coconut milk in a small saucepan over low heat. Cook and stir for 1 minute, or until the sugar dissolves. Transfer the sauce to a jug.
Step 12: Divide the pancakes among serving plates, drizzle with the coconut-lime sauce, and serve immediately with lime wedges.

Garnish with toasted coconut flakes and lime wedges.  Soft, diffused natural light from the side should highlight the pancake's golden texture and the sauce's glossiness. Shallow depth of field, focusing on the front pancake and sauce, creating a blurred background.  Convey a warm, inviting, and tropical mood.

video_script.title: Two-Ingredient Banana Pancakes

scenes.voice_over: In a mixing bowl, mash the bananas until smooth.  A fork works great for this.

scenes.image_prompt: A separate bowl with egg whites being beaten with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form.

scenes.image_prompt: Mashed bananas being gently folded into the beaten egg whites.
scenes.voice_over: Gently fold the mashed bananas into the beaten egg whites until just combined.  Be careful not to overmix, as this can deflate the egg whites.

scenes.voice_over: Heat a lightly oiled non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat.

scenes.image_prompt: Pouring 1/4 cup of batter onto the hot pan for each pancake.

cooking_tips: For sweeter pancakes, use overripe bananas.
Do not overmix the batter, as this can result in tough pancakes.

recipes.name: Classic Pancakes
directions: Step 1: Preheat an electric skillet or griddle to 380°F (193°C). In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt.
Step 2: In a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, melted butter (or margarine), and beaten eggs.

Step 3: Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir just until combined. Do not overmix. If the batter seems too thick, add a little more milk, 1 tablespoon at a time, until it reaches a pourable consistency.
Step 4: Lightly grease the preheated skillet or griddle with butter or cooking spray.
Step 5: Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the hot surface for each pancake.
Step 6: Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through. Flip when bubbles start to form on the surface and the edges look set.
Step 7: Serve immediately with your favorite toppings.

recipes.name: Honey-Lemon Banana Pancakes
ingredients: 1 medium banana, peeled and thinly sliced
directions: Step 1: In a blender, combine the cottage cheese, sour cream, 1 tablespoon of honey, vanilla extract, and salt. Blend until smooth.
Step 2: In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs until frothy. Add the cottage cheese mixture and whisk to combine.
Step 3: In a separate small bowl, whisk together the flour and baking powder. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing gently until just combined. Do not overmix.
Step 4: Lightly dust the banana slices with flour and set aside.
Step 5: Heat a lightly oiled griddle or large skillet over medium heat.
Step 6: Pour 1/8 cup of batter onto the hot griddle for each pancake. Immediately place a few banana slices in the center of each pancake.
Step 7: Spoon a small amount of batter over the banana slices to cover them.
Step 8: Cook for 1 1/2 to 2 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
Step 9: Transfer the cooked pancakes to a baking sheet and keep warm in a preheated oven set to the lowest temperature while you cook the remaining pancakes.
Step 10: In a small saucepan, combine the remaining 1/2 cup honey and lemon juice. Heat over low heat for 2 minutes, or until warmed through.
Step 11: Serve the pancakes immediately, drizzled with the warm honey-lemon syrup.

recipes.name: Crispy Potato Pancakes
ingredients: 1 green chili, seeded and thinly sliced (optional)
2 tablespoons cooking oil (rice bran oil recommended)
directions: Step 1: Grate the potatoes using a food processor or grater. Place the grated potatoes in a fine-mesh sieve or colander set over a bowl and let sit for 5 minutes to drain excess water.
Step 2: Grate the onion using a food processor or grater.
Step 3: Combine the grated potatoes and onion in a bowl. Add the salt and mix well.
Step 4: Discard the drained water from the bowl, but scrape any remaining potato starch from the bottom of the bowl and add it back to the potato mixture. This helps to create crispier pancakes.
Step 5: Heat the cooking oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Step 6: Once the oil is hot, drop spoonfuls of the potato mixture onto the skillet, flattening them slightly with the back of the spoon.
Step 7: (Optional) If using green chilies, place a few slices on top of each pancake when they are about 70-80% cooked on the first side.
Step 8: Cook for 3-4 minutes per side, or until golden brown and crispy, flipping once the first side is cooked through. Lightly press down on the pancakes with a spatula to ensure even cooking.
Step 9: If desired, flip the pancakes a second time to ensure they are cooked through and extra crispy.
Step 10: Serve the potato pancakes warm, ideally with a Korean pancake dipping sauce or your preferred condiment.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture crispy potato pancakes, golden brown and stacked slightly overlapping, on a dark slate surface.  Use a shallow depth of field, focusing sharply on the front pancakes. Backlight the scene to highlight the crispy edges and texture. Garnish with a dollop of sour cream and a sprinkle of fresh chives. Include a rustic wooden spatula and a linen napkin in the background for a touch of warmth. Aim for a warm, inviting mood with rich color saturation and subtle shadows.  Compose from a slightly elevated angle.

video_script.title: Crispy Potato Pancakes
video_script.description: Learn how to make crispy and delicious potato pancakes with this easy-to-follow recipe.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a stack of golden-brown, crispy potato pancakes, with a small bowl of dipping sauce on the side. Steam gently rises from the pancakes.
scenes.voice_over: Craving a crispy and savory treat?  These potato pancakes are simple to make and perfect as a side dish or a snack.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of the ingredients arranged neatly on a wooden cutting board: 2 peeled potatoes, 1/2 peeled onion, 1 sliced green chili (optional), salt, and a small bowl of cooking oil.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: two medium potatoes, half a medium onion, one green chili (optional), half a teaspoon of salt, and two tablespoons of cooking oil. Rice bran oil is recommended for its high smoke point.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a hand grating potatoes using a food processor with the grated potatoes falling into the bowl below. Inset shows a hand grating potatoes using a box grater.
scenes.voice_over: First, grate the potatoes using a food processor or a grater.  Place the grated potatoes in a fine-mesh sieve over a bowl and let them sit for five minutes to drain the excess water.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a hand grating half an onion using a grater. Inset shows grating with a food processor.
scenes.voice_over: Next, grate the onion using the same method.

scenes.image_prompt: A bowl with grated potatoes and onions. A hand is mixing the ingredients together with salt.
scenes.voice_over: Combine the grated potatoes and onion in a bowl. Add the salt and mix thoroughly. Don't forget to scrape any potato starch from the bottom of the bowl where the potatoes drained – this will help make the pancakes crispier!

scenes.image_prompt: Cooking oil being heated in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Small bubbles are starting to appear in the oil.
scenes.voice_over: Heat two tablespoons of cooking oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.

scenes.image_prompt: Spoonfuls of the potato mixture being dropped onto the hot skillet and flattened slightly with the back of a spoon.
scenes.voice_over: Once the oil is hot, drop spoonfuls of the potato mixture onto the skillet, flattening them slightly. Cook for 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a spatula flipping a golden-brown potato pancake in the skillet. The pancake is crispy around the edges.
scenes.voice_over: Flip the pancakes and cook the other side until golden brown and crispy. Lightly press down with a spatula for even cooking.  If you're using green chilies, add them now, towards the end of cooking time on the first side.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a plate stacked with golden brown, crispy potato pancakes, with a small bowl of dipping sauce. Fresh green herbs are garnished on top.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your potato pancakes warm with a dipping sauce. Korean pancake dipping sauce is a great option, but feel free to use your favorite.

cooking_tips: For extra crispy pancakes, you can add a tablespoon of cornstarch or potato starch to the batter.
If you don't have rice bran oil, you can use vegetable oil or canola oil.
Serve with sour cream, applesauce, or a dipping sauce of your choice.

recipes.name: Apple Cinnamon Pancakes with Mascarpone Cream
directions: Step 1: Prepare the pancake batter according to package directions.
Step 2: Melt 5g of butter in a 16cm non-stick frying pan over medium-low heat.
Step 3: Add 3-4 apple slices to the pan and cook for 1 minute per side, or until slightly softened.
Step 4: Pour 1/6 of the pancake batter over the apples and cook for 2 minutes, or until bubbles appear on the surface.
Step 5: Flip the pancake and cook until golden brown.
Step 6: Repeat steps 2-5 with the remaining butter, apple slices, and pancake batter.
Step 7: In a bowl, combine the mascarpone cheese and cinnamon.
Step 8: Top each pancake with the mascarpone mixture and drizzle with maple syrup.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a stack of three apple cinnamon pancakes, the top one slightly askew revealing the mascarpone cream and thinly sliced, caramelized apples within.  Use soft, diffused natural light from the side to highlight the textures of the fluffy pancakes and glistening syrup drizzle.  A rustic wooden background and linen napkin should complement the warm tones.  Focus on the center of the stack with a shallow depth of field, blurring the background slightly. Garnish with a sprig of fresh thyme and a dusting of cinnamon. Aim for a cozy, inviting mood.

video_script.title: Apple Cinnamon Pancakes with Mascarpone Cream
video_script.description: Learn how to make delicious apple cinnamon pancakes with a creamy mascarpone topping in this easy-to-follow recipe tutorial.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a stack of apple cinnamon pancakes with mascarpone cream and a generous drizzle of maple syrup. The pancakes are golden brown and fluffy, with visible apple slices.
scenes.voice_over: Indulge in the warm, comforting flavors of apple cinnamon pancakes topped with a luscious mascarpone cream. Let's get started!

scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: buttermilk pancake mix, fresh red apples, butter, mascarpone cheese, ground cinnamon, and maple syrup for that perfect touch of sweetness.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a bowl with pancake batter being whisked together. Show the package of pancake mix in the background.
scenes.voice_over: Prepare the pancake batter according to the package directions. Whisk until smooth and set aside.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of apple slices being sautéed in butter in a non-stick frying pan over medium-low heat.
scenes.voice_over: Melt 5g of butter in a non-stick pan over medium-low heat. Add the thinly sliced apples and sauté for about a minute per side until slightly softened.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of pancake batter being poured over sautéed apples in the frying pan.
scenes.voice_over: Pour 1/6 of the pancake batter over the apples in the pan.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a pancake being flipped in the frying pan. Show the cooked side with golden brown color and visible apple slices.
scenes.voice_over: Cook for about 2 minutes, or until bubbles start to appear on the surface. Then, flip the pancake and cook until golden brown, about 1-2 minutes more.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of mascarpone cheese being mixed with ground cinnamon in a bowl.
scenes.voice_over: In a bowl, combine the mascarpone cheese and cinnamon. Mix well.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a stack of finished apple cinnamon pancakes being topped with mascarpone cream and drizzled with maple syrup.
scenes.voice_over: Top each pancake with the mascarpone mixture and drizzle generously with maple syrup.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of a plate with a stack of apple cinnamon pancakes, garnished with a few fresh apple slices and a sprinkle of cinnamon. A fork and knife are placed beside the plate.
scenes.voice_over: These apple cinnamon pancakes are a perfect treat for breakfast or brunch. Serve immediately and enjoy! Each serving contains approximately 250-300 calories, 5-7g of protein, 40-50g of carbs, and 10-15g of fat.

cooking_tips: For extra flavor, add a pinch of nutmeg to the mascarpone mixture.
If you don't have mascarpone cheese, you can substitute with cream cheese or Greek yogurt.
Serve with a side of fresh fruit for a complete meal.

recipes.name: Classic Pancakes
directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, whisk the egg until light and fluffy.
Step 2: Add the milk and melted margarine (or butter) to the egg and whisk to combine.
Step 3: In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Step 4: Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. Do not overmix.
Step 5: Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium heat. You'll know it's hot enough when a drop of water sizzles and evaporates quickly.
Step 6: Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the hot griddle for each pancake.
Step 7: Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through, flipping when bubbles start to form on the surface and the edges look set.
Step 8: Serve immediately with your favorite toppings.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a stack of three golden-brown classic pancakes, drizzled with maple syrup and a pat of melting butter on top. Use soft, diffused natural light from the side to highlight the fluffy texture and golden edges.  A shallow depth of field focuses sharply on the front pancake, blurring the background of a rustic wooden table with a linen napkin and a small pitcher of syrup. Style with fresh berries scattered around the plate for a pop of color.  The mood should be warm, inviting, and comforting, evoking a sense of home-cooked goodness. Shoot from a slightly elevated angle to showcase the height and layers of the pancakes.

video_script.title: Classic Pancakes: Fluffy and Delicious

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a stack of golden brown pancakes, syrup dripping down the sides, topped with fresh berries and a pat of butter. Focus on the fluffy texture and inviting appearance.

scenes.image_prompt: Whisk vigorously beating an egg in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Show the change in texture.
scenes.voice_over: Start by whisking one large egg in a large bowl until it's light and fluffy. This helps create air for lighter pancakes.

scenes.voice_over: Add 3/4 cup milk and 2 tablespoons of melted butter to the egg. Whisk everything together until it’s well combined.

scenes.image_prompt: Flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt being whisked together in a separate bowl.
scenes.voice_over: In a separate bowl, whisk together 1 cup of all-purpose flour, 1 tablespoon of sugar, 3 teaspoons of baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt.

scenes.image_prompt: Dry ingredients being gradually added to the wet ingredients, mixing gently until just combined. Show a close-up of the batter, highlighting it’s slightly lumpy texture.
scenes.voice_over: Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing gently until just combined. Be careful not to overmix, as this can make the pancakes tough.

scenes.image_prompt: A lightly oiled griddle or frying pan heating over medium heat. A drop of water sizzling on the hot surface, evaporating quickly.
scenes.voice_over: Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium heat. It’s ready when a drop of water sizzles and evaporates quickly.

scenes.image_prompt: 1/4 cup of batter being poured onto the hot griddle, forming a round pancake. Show several pancakes cooking on the griddle at once.
scenes.voice_over: Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the hot griddle for each pancake. Cook for about 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown.

scenes.image_prompt: A spatula carefully flipping a pancake on the griddle. The flipped side is golden brown and cooked through.
scenes.voice_over: Flip the pancakes when bubbles start to form on the surface and the edges look set. Cook for another 2-3 minutes on the other side.

scenes.image_prompt: A stack of cooked pancakes on a plate, topped with various toppings such as fresh berries, whipped cream, chocolate chips, and syrup.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your pancakes immediately with your favorite toppings.  Enjoy! These pancakes have about 200-250 calories per serving, with 5-7 grams of protein, 30-35 grams of carbs, and 5-8 grams of fat.

cooking_tips: Don't overmix the batter, as this can make the pancakes tough.
For fluffier pancakes, let the batter rest for 5-10 minutes before cooking.
Use a non-stick griddle or frying pan for best results.

recipes.name: Classic Pancakes
directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, sift together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt twice.
Step 2: In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg, milk, and melted butter.
Step 3: Gently fold the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients using a wooden spoon or spatula. Mix until just combined. Do not overmix.
Step 4: Heat a lightly greased griddle or frying pan over medium heat.
Step 5: To test if the pan is hot enough, sprinkle a few drops of water onto the surface. The water should sizzle and evaporate quickly.
Step 6: Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the hot griddle for each pancake.
Step 7: Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through. Flip the pancakes when bubbles start to form on the surface and the edges look set.
Step 8: Serve immediately with your favorite toppings, such as lemon juice and sugar, golden syrup, or maple syrup.

scenes.image_prompt: A stack of golden brown pancakes on a plate, topped with a pat of butter and drizzled with maple syrup. A fork is placed next to the pancakes.
scenes.voice_over: Today, we're making classic, fluffy pancakes! This recipe is simple, quick, and perfect for a weekend breakfast or brunch.

scenes.image_prompt: A table with all dry ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, displayed in their containers/bowls.
scenes.voice_over: Let's start with the dry ingredients. You'll need 1 1/2 cups of all-purpose flour, 1 tablespoon of sugar, 4 teaspoons of baking powder, and 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon of salt for that perfect balance.

scenes.image_prompt: The wet ingredients – milk, eggs and butter – are displayed in a separate bowl.
scenes.voice_over: For the wet ingredients, we have 1 large egg, 1 1/4 cups of milk, and 4 tablespoons of melted unsalted butter.

scenes.image_prompt: A person sifting dry ingredients in a bowl
scenes.voice_over: Sift the dry ingredients together twice into a large bowl. This helps to aerate the mixture, which results in lighter, fluffier pancakes.

scenes.image_prompt: Whisking egg, milk, and melted butter together
scenes.voice_over: In a separate bowl, whisk the egg, milk, and melted butter together until well combined.

scenes.image_prompt: Folding wet ingredients into dry ingredients. Close-up.
scenes.voice_over: Now, gently fold the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Be careful not to overmix. Just mix until the ingredients are combined. A few lumps are perfectly okay.

scenes.image_prompt: Pan on the stove top with water drops sizzling on it. Focus on the sizzle.
scenes.voice_over: Heat a lightly greased griddle or frying pan over medium heat. To check if it's ready, a few drops of water should sizzle and evaporate quickly. Aim for around 350°F if using a griddle with a thermometer. This can take 2-3 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Pouring batter onto the hot griddle. Close-up.
scenes.voice_over: Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the hot griddle for each pancake.

scenes.image_prompt: Pancakes cooking on the griddle, bubbles forming on the surface.
scenes.voice_over: Cook for about 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown. Flip when bubbles start to form on the surface and the edges look set.

scenes.image_prompt: A stack of cooked golden pancakes with a variety of toppings such as maple syrup, chocolate syrup, blueberries, strawberries, and whipped cream.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your pancakes immediately with your favorite toppings! Maple syrup, fresh fruit, a dollop of whipped cream, or whatever you love. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: Don't overmix the batter, as this can lead to tough pancakes.
Let the batter rest for a few minutes before cooking to allow the gluten to relax.
Adjust the heat as needed to prevent burning. If the pancakes are browning too quickly, reduce the heat.
Use a non-stick griddle or frying pan for easy flipping and cleanup.

video_script.title: Classic Buttermilk Pancakes: Fluffy & Easy
video_script.description: Learn how to make perfect, fluffy buttermilk pancakes from scratch using Bisquick. This simple recipe is quick, easy, and delivers delicious results every time.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a stack of golden brown, fluffy buttermilk pancakes, topped with a pat of melting butter and a drizzle of maple syrup.  A fork is cutting into a pancake, revealing the soft, airy interior.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making classic buttermilk pancakes that are fluffy, light, and incredibly easy to make. This recipe is perfect for a weekend breakfast or a quick weekday meal.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of the three ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden table: a bag of Bisquick mix, a carton of milk, and a carton of eggs.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: 2 cups of Bisquick mix, 1 cup of milk, and 2 large eggs.  Simple, right?

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a griddle or skillet with a few drops of water sprinkled on it. The water droplets are dancing and disappearing, indicating the surface is hot enough.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your griddle or skillet over medium-high heat, or an electric griddle to 375°F. Test if it's ready by sprinkling a few drops of water; they should dance and evaporate quickly.

scenes.image_prompt: A mixing bowl with Bisquick mix, milk, and eggs being whisked together.  Show the whisk in motion and the batter coming together, still slightly lumpy.
scenes.voice_over: In a mixing bowl, whisk together the Bisquick, milk, and eggs until just combined. Don't overmix; a few lumps are okay.

scenes.image_prompt: Batter being poured from a measuring cup or ladle onto a hot griddle, forming a round pancake. Focus on the pouring action and the batter spreading on the griddle.
scenes.voice_over: Pour slightly less than 1/4 cup of batter onto the hot griddle for each pancake.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a pancake cooking on the griddle. Bubbles forming on the surface and the edges starting to look dry.
scenes.voice_over: Cook for about 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through. You'll see bubbles form on the surface and the edges will look dry when it's time to flip.

scenes.image_prompt: A spatula carefully flipping a golden brown pancake on the griddle.
scenes.voice_over: Carefully flip the pancake and cook the other side for another 2-3 minutes, until golden brown.

scenes.image_prompt: A stack of cooked pancakes on a plate, topped with butter, syrup, and fresh berries. A fork is placed next to the plate.
scenes.voice_over: Transfer the cooked pancakes to a plate and serve immediately. Top with your favorite toppings like butter, syrup, fresh fruit, or whipped cream. Enjoy!

scenes.voice_over: Each serving has approximately 200-250 calories, 6-8 grams of protein, 30-35 grams of carbs, and 8-10 grams of fat.

cooking_tips: For fluffier pancakes, let the batter rest for 5 minutes before cooking.
Do not overmix the batter, as this can result in tough pancakes.
Adjust the heat as needed to prevent burning. If pancakes are browning too quickly, reduce the heat slightly.
